programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May head to New Zealand to take part in a race along the coastline to the tip of the North Island - with one behind the wheel of a car and the other in an America's Cup yacht. Back in the UK, Richard Hammond tries out three hot hatches as he puts the Renaultsport Clio 200, Peugeot 208 GTi and Ford Fiesta ST through their paces, and a host of stars including Warwick Davis, Charles Dance and Joss Stone assemble at the test track to welcome a new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedians Lucy Porter and Romesh Ranganathan and TV judge Robert Rinder to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Vigilant Customs and Border Protection officers uncover 5,000 rounds of ammunition being smuggled across Hidalgo Bridge into Mexico.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier champions two teams of car lovers on their mission to design and build scrap vehicles capable of beating pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar in a daring challenge. This time, they take on the iconic Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a handling head to head. Their mechanical ingenuity and driving skills are put to the ultimate test as they race against both the supercar and the clock.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson drives the Jaguar F-Type sports car on some of Britain's finest roads, while Richard Hammond jumps inside the Range Rover Sport and gives it a thorough workout off-road, on a track and in what he believes is its most natural habitat - the lanes of Cheshire. James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A new recruit fresh out of training school makes her mark when she uncovers 12kg of cocaine hidden in a car that she has stopped on one of the bridges.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier leads two teams of car buffs in an engineering contest against pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar. This time, they take on the iconic Land Rover Discovery in an off-road hill climb. To defeat such a thoroughbred, the teams need to demonstrate their innovation and imagination.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team takes the BMW M3, Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG and Audi RS4 to Spain for a thorough test of performance. David Tennant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, James May drives a Jaguar XF and Richard Hammond wonders what happened to that ultimate symbol of 1960s grooviness - the beach buggy.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: Undercover cameras help to explore the world of animal intelligence, ingenuity and creativity in their hunting, protection and health. Spy Orang-utan meets her real-life counterparts in Borneo to capture how, living close to local people, they have gained unexpected skills in sawing wood and washing with soap, while Spy Termite catches one of the world's cleverest animal tricksters, the drongo, as he tries to outwit a group of meerkats in the battle for food.

Classic comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: The undercover cameras reveal how animals rely upon each other for a range of activities. Arctic wolves group together to survive in one of the harshest landscapes on earth, a band of hungry mongoose groom warthogs for tasty morsels - before turning their attention to Spy Warthog - and fish help clean hippos' bodies, as well as providing a unique dental service. Meanwhile, crocodiles and dikkop birds take part in a mutual neighbourhood watch against hungry prowling monitor lizards, and Spy Rattlesnake captures how prairie dogs and burrowing owls use their language skills to tell the rest of their community of approaching danger.

programme.title: Impossible Railways

programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The theories, conspiracies and facts relating to Rudolf Hess's dramatic flight to Scotland in 1941 and his subsequent death in Spandau prison.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh, in his capacity as Ranger of the Great Park, takes a tour of Windsor's grounds and points out the modifications he has made during his tenure, including a deer park and a farm shop selling local produce. He then competes in the Royal Horse Show, which also features Prince Harry. Meanwhile, the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall host a special banquet for the Prince's Trust.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn goes behind the scenes at London's King's Cross station and finds out about the disused funicular railway hidden in the Avon Gorge in Bristol, blasted out of the cliff.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek dives into the lost Jowett marque, as a Bradford-built 1952 Javelin finds an unexpected home. Paul and Dave uncover a Ford Escort that's been untouched for 30 years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise in America
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross tells the story of the comedy duo's attempts to become stars in America during the 1960s, via their appearances on The Ed Sullivan Show. Featuring footage never seen in Britain before, as well as personal home movies from Eric and Ernie's own collections, this episode tells of Morecambe and Wise's first steps in their American adventure. Interviewees include Glenda Jackson, Diana Rigg, Gina Yashere, Penn & Teller, Shappi Khorsandi, Jon Culshaw and Nicholas Parsons.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene, in disguise as his own twin brother, faces the unenviable task of arranging a funeral - for himself. Meanwhile, Herr Flick insists his senior officers attend in a bid to seek out members of the Resistance. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The communists capture Von Strohm and Geering, but they are soon rescued by a Gaullist group, recovering a valuable painting in the process. Comedy, starring Richard Marner and Sam Kelly.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.sub-title: The Dance of the Hitler Youth
programme.desc: The Germans celebrate the burning of the Reichstag with a little Bavarian dancing, while Rene breaks into Herr Flick's lair and the British airmen attempt to cross the channel by rowing boat.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: It is work experience day, but Bren cannot show the new girl a typical routine in the canteen because the new boy has blocked the front of the cooker with his ladder - which the bread delivery woman refuses to go under. Canteen comedy, with Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow, Sue Cleaver and Shobna Gulati.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren is so excited about her forthcoming holiday with Tony she even considers buying some new clothes, and while a forlorn Stan tells everyone his sad news, Petula gets a little hot under the collar in her caravan. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: A grand tour of the solar system, unravelling secrets that the planets have harboured for millions of years, and discovering that Earth almost never existed at all.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. He begins with a towpath exploration of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Setting off from Liverpool, he takes a three-day walk inland to Wigan, ending at the town's iconic pier as he traces the story of the waterway's chaotic construction and its impact on the development of Lancashire.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston tells the story of Hitler's state executioner, who was placed in charge of killing thousands of people declared enemies of the state.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to examine more items brought in by viewers, beginning with a visit to Plas Newydd Country House and Gardens on Anglesey. Collectibles assessed include a Victorian cane carved with an image of the Menai suspension bridge, an 18th century grandmother clock, and two giant toy giraffes.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: This episode looks at life on the highest mountain range on Earth, the Himalayas, home to many extraordinary animals and remarkable ancient cultures. The programme follows snow leopards as they creep into isolated mountain villages searching for food, and monkeys huddling for warmth in a hidden, frozen forest, and the athletes who compete in the gruelling Everest marathon.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an insight into the most successful animals on the planet. Observing an Arctic fox stalk prey in its -20C environment, he reveals warm-bloodedness as one of the key factors in the mammals' global domination. He also studies marsupials in Australia and Central America, offering a unique view inside a platypus's breeding burrow.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Victoria and Albert's Highland Fling
programme.desc: Tony Robinson visits the Cairngorms National Park to discover how Queen Victoria and Prince Albert helped shape Scottish traditions and imagery, such as tartan, bagpipes and caber-tossing. Starting in Pitlochry, he traverses the Killiecrankie Pass, where the Jacobites won the Battle of Killiecrankie, and ends his trek at Balmoral and the fantasy castle Albert built as his and Victoria's Highland escape.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Vatican Archives

programme.desc: The final episode focuses on life on the longest mountain range in the world, the Andes, home to astonishing hidden worlds, and extraordinary animals and people. Cameras follow a female puma and her three cubs as they hunt in the mountains of the frozen south, and the descendants of the Inca gather in an ancient ceremony to build a bridge made from woven grass.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough offers an insight into insect-eating animals, including shrews that dive under water, moles that can 'swim' in the Namib Desert, and New Zealand bats that hunt in packs on the ground, walking on their wrists and foraging. Plus, how hedgehogs and armadillos liven up their diet with fruit and birds' eggs, while pangolins and giant anteaters survive entirely on a diet of insects.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Nazi Occupation - Channel Islands
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to Guernsey and Jersey to tell the story of the islands' surrender to the Nazis during the Second World War. In Guernsey, he hears of the first bombing raid that heralded the German troops' arrival and sees the spot where the first-ever British commando landed in secret, only to see the planned revenge raid fail spectacularly. A ferry then takes him on to Jersey, where he finds almost all of its beaches have a bunker or a machine gun post left over from the conflict.

programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates a secret department of the Bulgarian government charged with carrying out assassinations in nine other countries during the Cold War.

programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an episode from RAF Coningsby, an operational air base in Lincolnshire, where she takes to the sky in a Dakota aircraft and examines some air force memorabilia including a teddy bear that was on board one of the Dambuster planes and designs for the Vulcan bomber. Items brought in to be valued include a painting by John Singer Sergeant, a crystal decanter and an officer's coat from the American Civil War.

programme.title: Ganges
programme.desc: Exploring the story of the river, following its course from the Himalayas to their foothills. The programme reveals its enormous influence on the day-to-day living of a continent, how it has shaped Indian culture and religion and why it attracts a vast array of wildlife including snow leopards, Asiatic brown bears and bearded vultures.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

Drama, with Leslie Ash, Luke de Woolfson, Philip Middlemiss and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley himself becomes a suspect when the boy's sister is found dead, forcing him to enlist the help of his lawyer and DS McCaffrey's son to prove his innocence. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Strickland's Whitehall pal Stephen Fisher is targeted by an assassin, so the Ucos boss enlists the team to find whoever was responsible. He reveals that 30 years earlier, he and Fisher were involved in a covert MI5 operation to break into the house of a journalist believed to have information on an IRA arms deals. But with several of the original agents having died in suspicious circumstances, he believes someone is out to kill them all - and when a connection is made between a gangster and MI5, it seems the threat may be coming from within the security service itself. Tim McInnerny and Kerry Fox guest star.

programme.desc: In this feature-length episode of the drama, Sam's professional skills are tested to the limit following the murder of a close friend, and the evidence leads her into a deadly game with a deranged psychopath. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Nick Reding.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

Connie offers Sam a position as trainee rep as the pair grow closer, much to Chrissie's annoyance, and a patient's dad asks Lola out on a date.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. A burns victim overhears Holly discussing Adam's HIV status and sells the story to a national newspaper, plunging Holby A&E into chaos as reporters besiege the department and leaving Charlie the responsibility of informing the blissfully ignorant nurse of the situation. Meanwhile, a girl's shopping spree almost ends in tragedy, Chloe encounters an unwelcome face from the past and Josh risks his life performing a rescue on a cliff face.

programme.title: The Bill

Iona moves into the big house while her own is rebuilt, and Zoe's unimpressed by Ewan when he covers for Amy. Highland drama, with Lloyd Owen and Kellyanne Farquhar.

Meanwhile, Sally catches truant schoolboy Nathan in a compromising situation with Candida, and Anna fears for the health of elderly farm owner Essie Crayford. Rural drama, starring Philip Middlemiss, Kelly Wenham and Danny Seward.

programme.sub-title: If You Go Down to the Woods
programme.desc: Marlene is distraught when Tyler and Earl the dog go missing. Boycie, Bryan and Jed form a search party, but hunting through the haunted woods at night proves a less than pleasant experience for the would-be rescuers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo hit on a solution to their transport problems - building their own bikes. Meanwhile, Sid and Ivy's cafe has been redecorated and is set for its grand re-opening. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate a skydiving accident and discover that someone had tampered with the victim's parachute. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate when the lifeless body of Gemma, a 17-year-old estate agent, is found in an empty house. Delving into the girl's family history, the forensic pathologist discovers she was thrown out of her home by her mother for having a child at the age of 13. Claims that Gemma was having an affair with her mother's second husband further complicates Sam's inquiries. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.desc: Jane helps the roguish antiques dealer search for a valuable Yeats painting in Ireland, until a more important matter captures their attention. Ian McShane stars.

programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.desc: The lads move into a grim little hut on the Chocanaw reservation and set about rebuilding the bridge, but Barry begins to go off the rails as he remembers the good times with Tatiana. Work goes well thanks to help from Joe's son Chip - but Granger is livid to discover he has been made a fool of, and vows to have his revenge. Tim Healy and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet

Drama, starring Tim Healy, Timothy Spall, Kevin Whately, Christopher Fairbank and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The boss of Brokenwood agricultural show dies after a ride on the Ghost Train, and the investigation reveals his suspected heart attack was something far more sinister.

programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part Two
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy and Brackenreid goes after the corrupt copper.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Alex investigates a burglary and assault at the home of her future in-laws - a case that brings her face to face with 14-year-old Peter Drake, who will grow up to be her husband and Molly's father. Gene's initial lack of interest in the case ends when the fingerprints of a supposedly dead gangster are found at the scene, and he seizes the opportunity to get more positive headlines for the Met.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A murder victim is discovered in a canal, and Gene soon has his prime suspect when it turns out the dead man was mixed up with loan shark Trevor Riley. In their search for incriminating evidence, Gene and the team resort to breaking into Riley's office after hours - but what they find takes the case in a completely different direction. Guest starring Tom Georgeson and Daisy Haggard.

programme.desc: James returns to his home town of Bolton to defend a couple living in a run-down flat who have been accused of murdering their baby daughter. However, conflicting testimony soon brings him up against his learned friend, Head of Chambers Peter Foxcott. Starring John Thaw, Oliver Ford Davies and Haydn Gwynne.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: First of two-part crime drama from the prolific pen of Lynda La Plante. DCI Roisin Connor is called in to investigate the gruesome discovery of a woman's severed hand in the River Thames, and soon finds herself pitted against rival officer Chief Superintendent Mike Walker as they are drawn into a deadly game with a psychotic killer. Victoria Smurfit and David Hayman star.

programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor opens her new infirmary for the poor, but also agrees to help in her father's private practice. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Daddy has an accident while chasing a milkwoman on his bicycle, and ends up heavily sedated in hospital. First-ever episode of the suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and George Webb.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth invites the new vicar round for tea - but despite her meticulous planning, the afternoon does not go as planned. Sitcom about a super-snob intent on climbing the social ladder, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Jeremy Gittins.

programme.desc: Hyacinth visits a stately home, where she naturally tries her hardest to meet the lord of the manor - only to be thwarted by the untimely arrival of Onslow and Daisy. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.desc: A distant cousin of Fred's who has Down's syndrome is taken in by the Buckles following the death of his protective mother, but Violet struggles to cope and Shelagh is forced to make other arrangements for his care. Highland drama, starring Lloyd Owen, Alexander Morton and Martin Compston.

Nathan is heartbroken when Candida reveals she plans to tour the world during her gap year and Rita confesses she suspects her husband Martin is having an affair. programme.desc: Abra returns to the hospital, but Ric is not happy to be working with him - especially when he learns the surgeon has been making promises to patients that he will struggle to keep. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max tries to win the confidence of a newly arrived Czech refugee whose daughter has been hit by an airport baggage truck, while Charlie has trouble taking care of baby Louis, and a stand-up comic takes a nasty tumble during a performance. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Robert Gwilym.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline is making Petes funeral arrangements which is stressing Arthur out! Richards gives Mandy and Adrian some bad news and Mark is not feeling well.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Aidan's troubles are getting to him, Nadia attempts to get Phil's attention, Frank doesn't appreciate Pat's attempts to solve their financial problems and Pete is laid to rest.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The strain of bringing up a child begins to show on Nick, Carole doubts her abilities and a garage blaze leads to danger.

programme.desc: Amy accidentally takes a photograph of what appears to be a monster emerging from the depths of Loch Bogle. A sceptical Paul has more pressing matters on his mind in the form of financial worries and the imminent departure of Iona. Ewan, however, is quick to cash in on the commercial possibilities as scientists arrive to investigate the creature. Susan Hampshire and Lloyd Owen star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Unable to put the tragic loss of her baby behind her, a heartbroken Beth calls off the wedding, while the Scorpions decide to pose for a nude calendar to raise funds for the club's floodlights. Meanwhile, new parents Susan and Steve eagerly await Elaine's departure so they can be on their own with their baby _ little suspecting the houseguest has a surprise in store. Rural drama, starring Kerrie Taylor, Heather Peace, Daniel Ryan and Clare Holman.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon is convinced her 30th birthday is just the start of another three decades of misery, prompting Tracey to question the wisdom of throwing a party. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.desc: Boycie reluctantly signs up for Farm Idol, a new reality TV show aimed at finding Britain's sexiest rural workers, while Mrs Cakeworthy becomes suspicious of Marlene when a well-dressed man visits her while her husband is away. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo buys Sid's wetsuit and, under Foggy's supervision, tries scuba diving and waterskiing. Bill Owen and Brian Wilde star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo manages to convince a barmaid that hapless Foggy is really an eccentric millionaire, having made his fortune in the frozen turkey business. Long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge makes dangerous enemies by pressing the police for an inquiry into the death of Rufus Baron and also presides over the trial of the producers of a reality TV show, charged with manslaughter of a contestant. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Ben Caplan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 16-year-old case of an infamous getaway driver convicted of murdering his wife when new evidence suggests it could have been a miscarriage of justice. But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. When a Cambridge farmer dies beneath the blades of a combine harvester, Sam believes the death to be a tragic accident until an anonymous tip-off indicates more sinister forces are at work. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The strain of bringing up a child begins to show on Nick, Carole doubts her abilities and a garage blaze leads to danger.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pauline is making Petes funeral arrangements which is stressing Arthur out! Richards gives Mandy and Adrian some bad news and Mark is not feeling well.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers carry out a series of exercises in evacuating casualties from a combat zone, which leaves them convinced they are about to be sent on active duty.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Emotions run high as the regiment is sent on a dangerous assignment to Bosnia, and Phillip's handling of a sensitive situation jeopardises his relationship with Captain Williams.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh finally decides to accept Gabriel's marriage proposal, and Smithy patches up his friendship with Gina, who is feeling more amenable to his overtures now she's been given the cancer all-clear. Meanwhile, Roger agrees to investigate an assault on his estranged wife Sandra's new boyfriend Rick - whose reticence to discuss the incident is soon explained by the discovery that he's a crook.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra tries to help a patient waiting for a transplant by offering to operate with an animal organ, despite the procedure being illegal, and asks Mickie to assist him in theatre. Elliot monitors Margaret's condition as she returns from her stem cell treatment in Singapore, believing her case mirrors that of his wife, Gina.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A demonstration turns violent when squatters are evicted from their homes, and Josh and Finlay are forced to enter the fray. Later, they respond to a stabbing incident which places their lives in further danger. Meanwhile, Mel and Penny play Cupid to a cantankerous old man and his worried neighbour. Hospital drama, starring Kwame Kwei-Armah and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Reg organises a half-centenary celebration of Sun Hill, attended by dignitaries including former DCS Charles Barnett. On a less happy note, Amanda Prosser's insensitive treatment of a bereaved father provokes a hostage crisis, and the real Gabriel Kent turns up out of the blue, spelling big trouble for the unscrupulous copper who has assumed his identity.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The Fowlers are determined not to rise to the Chapman's bait. Phil is late for Kathy's party and Mandy & Aidan are left out in the cold.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Boxing day and Mandy and Aidan have to face the truth. Gita has some news for Sanjay and Phil is increasingly troubled about Nadia.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Carole is left in charge while Nick goes away to a conference, but things do not exactly go as smoothly as she would have hoped. Meanwhile, a new fire-fighter joins the team.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Tree surgeon Malcolm arrives to deal with the forest's blight problem - and Paul is dismayed to discover the newcomer is Iona's ex-fiance. Molly coaches Jess to compete in the ghillies' gruelling annual challenge, despite the fact the other competitors snub her efforts. Meanwhile, Ewan is envious when Amy starts spending a great deal of time with her art tutor. Highland drama, starring Lloyd Owen and Rae Hendrie.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Beth and Tom prepare to tie the knot, but reckon without a few last-minute hitches as Joe suddenly decides he can't be the best man and the bride worries over whether to invite her father. Meanwhile, Sally bites off more than she can chew, the green-eyed monster in Anna makes an appearance when Beth's cousin takes a shine to David and a multiple sclerosis sufferer requires assistance.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Darryl plots to spend a night with Tracey by escaping from hospital, while Sharon makes her own plans for the evening's entertainment. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie uncovers disturbing information regarding his ancestral line. Tyler's surprising return from university adds to his sense of worry, convincing him something serious is about to happen. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio scheme to get Wally out from under Nora Batty's thumb for a day, but come a cropper sneaking him back to the house. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Joe Gladwin.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a health farm on a day out, leading Foggy to devise an ingenious money-making scam - selling food to its famished inhabitants. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. Bacchus suspects the dead girl's music teacher, since rumours persist that she was having an affair with him. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called to examine the bodies recovered from a fatal helicopter crash, and her findings soon threaten to rip through the heart of the community living around the airfield. Drama about a forensic pathologist, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Reg organises a half-centenary celebration of Sun Hill, attended by dignitaries including former DCS Charles Barnett. On a less happy note, Amanda Prosser's insensitive treatment of a bereaved father provokes a hostage crisis, and the real Gabriel Kent turns up out of the blue, spelling big trouble for the unscrupulous copper who has assumed his identity.

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz, in which another line-up of contestants answer questions that could change their lives. All they have to do is hold their nerve through 15 questions, with four lifelines on hand to help them - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a large game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants Sean, Molly, Teresa and Roy answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including a woman being kicked by a horse, a driver who tears off her car door and a teenager falling face first into manure.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show Live
programme.desc: Everyday life has changed dramatically with everyone facing more restrictions - and more uncertainty. Martin Lewis presents another live special in which he and Angellica Bell will be examining how coronavirus could affect finances, and taking viewers' questions on specific issues.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Saving Money: Tips for Lockdown - Tonight
programme.desc: With pay cuts, job losses and businesses shut down for weeks, the financial impact of coronavirus is hitting people hard. Helen Skelton investigates the best ways for people to tighten their belts and try to save money.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp talks about his life and career as one of the most respected and experienced football managers in the modern game, as well as his victorious I'm a Celebrity appearance in 2018, when he was crowned King of the Jungle. He discusses the many twists and turns of his rollercoaster life, including a road accident in 1990 in which his friend Brian Tiler died. Harry also opens up about a dramatic dawn raid on his house and the death threats he received when he became manager of Southampton.

programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Malone and Harriet have another encounter, while Al is delighted when Priya reveals she is ready to go public with their relationship, but their plans are cut short when Jai walks in on them. Cain and Moira meet to finalise their divorce, and Leanna relishes wrecking her dad's relationship.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Oliver suffers another frightening seizure and is moved to intensive care, much to Steve and Leanne's horror. Ed and Michael experience racism at work, while Gemma attends a support group for her depression and takes comfort from realising other people are in the same position as her.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: As the comedy returns, there's bad news for the Stubbs family as they hear that Tracey's ex-husband has died and she has to decide what kind of send-off to give him. Sharon wants it to be nice for the boys, Chigwell's criminal fraternity are keen to make it special, while Dorien seems more interested in just finding the right outfit. Linda Robson, Pauline Quirke and Lesley Joseph star, with appearances from Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp and one-time EastEnder Jamie Foreman (Derek Branning).

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The family are devastated when unscrupulous burglars take advantage of their absence at Darryl's funeral to ransack the house. But rather than involve the Old Bill, they decide to track down their possessions themselves, setting out on a trail that takes them from a snooker parlour and a pawnbroker's to an infamous local drag club. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo continue to investigate one of the biggest and darkest cases they have ever faced. In the second edition, Rachel's safety is thrown into question when the killers change the rules of their sick game. Meanwhile, as a police officer, Janet is rendered powerless to protect her daughter, but she knows she must try to find a way to stop the madness. The crime drama returns for a fifth series, this time featuring a single crime throughout three parts. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Ben hops into the Rustbuggy for a driving lesson along the sand dunes of Cape Cod.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Jarring Jerkiness of the Judge J.O.R.T.S.
programme.desc: The boys' jorts-wearing Spanish teacher is inspired by Harold and George to become a superhero..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave's first plane journey doesn't go to plan when the air pressure and the need to go to the toilet makes his head swell..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef presents more highlights from the series, including recipes from Thomasina Miers, Nisha Katona and Jonathan Phang, and a meal prepared for actor Larry Lamb.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: On the next leg of his Islands to Highlands tour, James travels to Devon where he meets his friend and Michelin-starred chef Simon Hulstone. While they are in the area, James visits a mushroom farm, and Simon samples some award-winning cheese, which inspires James to prepare an extravagant cheese platter.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head for rural Cornwall, where they create a spectacular contemporary garden for Chris Finney, a former serviceman who was awarded the George Cross in 2003. A space age-inspired area - complete with solar dome - will test Chris's knowledge as a novice gardener, and provide a stimulating haven for his young family.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Wolverhampton, where Aidan Pass meets his match over a football cap, and Tony Geering pays over the odds for an item.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five dentistry students answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Cameroon v England. Gabriel Clarke introduces highlights of the thrilling 1990 World Cup quarter-final from Stadio San Paolo in Naples, Italy. With original coverage hosted by Nick Owen and Elton Welsby and pre-match analysis from Bobby Moore and Jimmy Greaves.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara present the second part of the semi-final, with the best competitors from four heats testing their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Glasgow to take part in a series of unusual challenges, with a prize of 1,000 up for grabs.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, however, they have all used up their Golden Buzzers already - each granting a place in the live semi-finals to their chosen acts.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes each week, he challenges presenter Stacey Solomon, comedian Joel Dommett and Coronation Street's Beverley Callard to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)
programme.desc: James Bond joins forces with a Chinese agent to foil a media mogul's scheme to start a war between their countries - a case complicated by the fact that an old flame is now married to his new enemy. Using an undetectable stealth ship, the press baron plans to launch an undetectable sneak attack on both nations' navies, knowing they will blame each other - giving him exclusive global media coverage of the resulting conflict. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, Teri Hatcher and Michelle Yeoh.

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The clumsy hero sets out to replace his worn-out sofa, but finds he does not have enough cash for a new one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds take the camper van on holiday, and end up at the bottom of the sea. Dave has to resort to a resourceful solution to get help..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave rescues an endangered donkey from the docks. Hiding it in the camper van, things take a turn when the donkey eats Gran's glasses..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James and fellow chef Mark Jordan discover the culinary delights of Guernsey. They sample local speciality Gache cake and a seafood platter fit for a king, while James uses the island's native dairy produce to make a creamy rice pudding with chargrilled peaches. The duo set themselves a fishing challenge by attempting to catch a mighty turbot, and James finishes the day by cooking a mouthwatering turbot dish.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Amman in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. He catches up with his old friend Maria who runs a cookery school, discovers how the country is becoming a serious wine-producing region and visits a bustling fruit and vegetable market for ingredients. Ainsley's dishes include chargrilled sumac lamb cutlets with tabbouleh and falafel with hummus.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: The duo are joined by Gordon and Tilly Ramsay, who prepare salmon en croute, and Juliet Sear, who makes thumbprint cookies. Plus, recipes for pull-apart bread stuffed with bacon and cheese, paella, patatas bravas, Greek salad, and strawberry pavlova.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: As summer begins, Delyth starts planning for the wedding season and the staff at Portmeirion celebrate the work of Susan Williams-Ellis - the pioneer behind its pottery. The programme also meets Rob Piercy, who has spent 25 years capturing the village on canvas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The owner of local country magazine Midsomer Life becomes a suspect when a man's body is discovered in woodland, and it is established the victim had been having an affair with his wife. As Barnaby and Jones delve into the case, another murder forces them to reassess their inquiries. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Simon Williams.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are at Wigan Athletic's DW Stadium, where Alys Dobbie is interested by a collection of cameras and Jon O'Marah finds out what a Corinthian aryballos is and Tony Geering assesses three 1966 World Cup trays.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Rowan Atkinson stars as the Parisian detective in this drama based on the novels of Georges Simenon. The summer of 1955 finds Paris in the grip of both sweltering heat and terror on the streets. Four women have been murdered in Montmartre, with no apparent connection between the victims. Chief Inspector Maigret comes under huge pressure from the public and his superiors to apprehend the killer before he can strike again. Fiona Shaw and Mark Heap head up the supporting cast.

programme.title: Mike Bassett: England Manager (2001)
programme.desc: An inept soccer coach is unexpectedly chosen as England's new manager. His dismal efforts see him go from national treasure to most hated man in England in record time - but the chance of redemption comes when a rules loophole puts his team in the running for the World Cup. Comedy, starring Ricky Tomlinson, Amanda Redman, Philip Jackson, Bradley Walsh and Phill Jupitus.

Alan Titchmarsh's challenge is to create a more child-friendly garden for their terraced home in Tonbridge, and his first task is to make a shady environment so the kids can spend time outside in the day. After that, he and the team come up with a bespoke lighting system for the evenings, acoustic fencing to cut down the noise from a nearby railway line, and an area for the parents.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: The second leg of the tour takes the boys to Italy, where they're holing up at a traditional Palazzo in Florence. Assistant Manager John Barnes thinks the lads need a bit of culture, so sends them off sightseeing to take in the Ponte Vecchio and Michelangelo's David. At training, fitness coach Luke Worthington puts the boys through their paces, but it's not looking good as the team is carrying so many injuries there are only three fit players. Plus, they've lost one of their biggest characters - Neil 'Razor' Ruddock - who had to leave the tour in Paris to return to London for tests on his heart.

programme.title: Harry's Heroes: The Full English
programme.sub-title: Harry's Heroes: Euro Having a Laugh
programme.desc: In the final episode, Harry, John and the team embark on the final leg of the tour in Germany, as they prepare to face their arch-rivals at the Wacker Arena in Burghausen. After checking into their Hotel in the Bavarian Alps, Harry receives the German team sheet, leaving him concerned his team are going to have to massively step up their game. With the fear of the match going to penalties hanging over their head, Harry brings in a German psychologist to offer some advice. Finally the big day arrives, and Harry has managed to recruit Manchester United legend Teddy Sheringham, so the team finally has its missing striker.
