programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to Germany to buy a Mercedes and gets his hands on a 1984 280SL, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with its brakes.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton takes on a huge project to restore and rebuild a German Panther tank. But to do so he must part with some Second World War 'halftracks'.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: OCC reveals a bike and a reverse trike for a company, while Mikey seeks counselling from Vinnie.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: Engineers on the Alaskan island of Sitka construct a colossal dam capable of powering an entire town. Plus, Alaska's biggest boat lift hauls a 400-ton fishing ship.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits California to extract minerals using explosives.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processing of almonds and the production of high-end motorcycles. Fish rubbing and clay shooting machines are also considered. Plus, developments in the techniques used over the years.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Where materials come from and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years, fosusing on candied fruit, linen ukuleles, throttle bottles and limestone mantels.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of Formula One racing cars, America's best-selling multi-tool and Finnish Aalto glassware.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard turns his attention to 'surprise buys' as he counts down through some of his most memorable purchases.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: It's Not All Mai Tais and Yahtzee
programme.desc: A crewman on the Seabrooke is nearly crushed by ice, and a loose pot turns into a half-ton wrecking ball on the Kodiak.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The rookie divers are keen to prove themselves, but their veteran competitors are not happy to hand over their pay packet to just anyone.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A giant brick tower is toppled next to a railway line. Meanwhile, one of Britain's veteran scrap kings ploughs his profits into racing cars.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Porsche 914 in a barn and thinks he can turn a profit on the 1970s sports car. Edd China has the tricky job of restoring it to a saleable condition.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini prepares for the Monterey car show and gets his 1952 Muntz Jet out of storage to ready it for sale.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is asked by a car enthusiast to sell a Maserati Bora and an S2 Bentley convertible.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary reveals how a classic British bike is being rebooted in India, and how radiation is used to beat art fraud.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into the life-saving science behind crash-testing cars. Plus, how expensive Dutch tableware is made, and the process of making hand-made, pocket-sized umbrellas.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The divers demonstrate the difficulties of preserving wild abalone stocks, which have gone extinct in some parts of the world due to over-fishing.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A deckhand and the captain of the Cornelia Marie clash over the vessel's crippling lack of bait, and the Time Bandit's newest crew member goes to pirate school.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: The twins ride the Redball Express, while Bruce Crompton blows up a van with Second World War rifle grenades and tracks down a 'Deuce-and-a-half' American army truck.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard embarks on a road trip, travelling to Norfolk, Pembroke and Essex. In Pembroke, he finds an old church that has been converted into an antiques store with a varied selection.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A training tower for firefighters is pulled apart. Meanwhile in Cheshire, Steve and Luke help a boat on its last journey and in Hampshire a scrap yard is torn down.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to Germany to buy a Mercedes and gets his hands on a 1984 280SL, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with its brakes.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With the end of the season fast approaching, the rookies risk cave-ins at their abandoned mine claim. Deep underground, Bomb King George is trapped in the blast zone.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Oswestry, Shropshire, to visit a salvage business that specialises in upcycling. Later, he visits one of Wales' most famous listed houses.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant work on a 1969 Opel GT, which suffers fresh body damage, a backfiring engine, shoddy brakes, and faulty headlights.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Walter brings his 1975 Bricklin back to the garage, with the hope that Dan can fix problems that were created when it was built. They then add missiles.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of working miniature airports, the design of houses to withstand hurricanes and the cultivation of rhubarb in the dark.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The way billions of bees help produce tons of California almonds, how snow is cleared to keep planes functional in Norway, and the removal of tricky stains.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of 5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: The twins ride the Redball Express, while Bruce Crompton blows up a van with Second World War rifle grenades and tracks down a 'Deuce-and-a-half' American army truck.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Jason is offended by Paul Sr's criticism of his designs, while PJD begins work on a bike to celebrate a company's centenary.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A rugged ship built to withstand tsunami-size waves travels on a highway unlike any other in North America. Plus, a fleet of machines combats a massive flood.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.sub-title: Dirty Jobs of the Big Apple
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to New York, where he experiences life working alongside an elevator repairman.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the creation of Montreal smoked meats and motorised scooters are detailed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Another selection of everyday items are deconstructed, including cactus pear puree and lab reactors.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in creating modern-day paving stones. Plus, the construction of a traditionally tailored tuxedo suit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard counts down some of the most memorable items he has picked up in amazing locales.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A deckhand and the captain of the Cornelia Marie clash over the vessel's crippling lack of bait, and the Time Bandit's newest crew member goes to pirate school.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The divers demonstrate the difficulties of preserving wild abalone stocks, which have gone extinct in some parts of the world due to over-fishing.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Southampton, a new cable-eating machine is ready to turn scrap into gold. Plus, the metal from a disused aeroplane is being turned into a profit in Hampshire.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A Bentley Le Mans Replica is being flown in from England, with Wayne Carini excited to test drive it.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is ecstatic when an exceptional collection of motorcycles and a classic Ferrari, worth between five and eight million dollars, comes up for sale.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into large-scale iron-mining operations in the Australian Outback. Plus, how the world's biggest wave machine is used for flood defences.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the development of the finest oyster knives, and the lights transforming sport worldwide. Plus, how diamonds grown in a greenhouse are behind a gemstone revolution.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.sub-title: The Sinking of the Lady Mary
programme.desc: In March 2009, scallop fishing boat the Lady Mary sank off the coast of New Jersey, killing six crew and leaving only one survivor. This edition explains how the tragedy occured.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An inexperienced crewman leaves the Seabrooke in shame, and treacherous waters surrounding St Paul island make offloading crab extremely hazardous.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce travels from Plymouth to Illinois by buying and selling various German hardware, while his mate Kevin purchases the last remaining German torpedo boat for five million pounds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a quiet south London suburb, Drew Pritchard comes face to face with the most extraordinary collection of American automobilia he's ever seen, including Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The work of demolition, salvage and waste management experts as they blast, crush and smash their way through a variety of structures which have had their day. In the world of destruction, they take huge risks, every time they blow up, demolish and dismantle. From tower blocks to ships and bridges to Victorian mansionsevery inch of material is removed as everything has value if you know where to take it and, more importantly, when to sell it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of 5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Col's crew takes one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a north London emporium full of antique shop fittings that will surprise. Then, Drew and Tee visit a Second World War hospital museum in Suffolk.

programme.title: Aliens: The Definitive Guide
programme.desc: Part one of two. Scientists investigate the possibility of extra-terrestrial life, beginning with what aliens might look like and how they could sound.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology series reveals how New York is able to run on steam, and details the processes perfected by Belgian monks responsible for making some of the world's finest beers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How volcanos contribute to the production of guacamole and the development of trucks capable of crossing swamps. Plus, the method used to produce the world-famous Fiskars scissors brand.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads for Turin to buy a Fiat 500, but the only way to get it back to the UK is to drive it, and the engine is in need of urgent attention.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce travels from Plymouth to Illinois by buying and selling various German hardware, while his mate Kevin purchases the last remaining German torpedo boat for five million pounds.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey and Paul Sr agree to meet but fail to reach consensus on the conditions they will meet under, while OCC builds a bike memorialising the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A machine with 588 sharp teeth helps keep the coldest airport in America running. Plus, mighty tugboats chew through ice chunks in Alaska.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes to the waters of Alaska aboard a fish-processing ship, where he is faced with the challenge of bleeding and gutting the day's catch.

programme.title: How It's Made

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.sub-title: We Have Not Yet Begun to Fight
programme.desc: Polar ice descends and each Skipper must choose flight or fight. The Saga is in danger of sinking and Jake needs to act quickly.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a Ferrari 308 GT4 within his budget, and when he secures one hopes that Edd China is up to the task of restoring it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer buys a 1974 Ferrari Dino, but has to wait for Edd China to restore it before he can sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers Revisited
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer track down the owner of the Alfa Romeo Spider they worked on in a previous series, and discover the vehicle has a new dent.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.
